alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 08 at 1:13PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive lake effect rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following counties, Jefferson, Lewis and Oswego. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 108 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oswego, Sandy Island Beach State Park, Stony Point, Carthage, Lowville, Pulaski, West Carthage, Adams, Redfield, Barnes Corners, Adams Center, Highmarket, Whetstone Gulf State Park, Southwick Beach State Park, Henderson Harbor, Selkirk Shores State Park, Mexico Point State Park, Nine Mile Point and Scriba. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
